Comparing covariance estimates between limmbo2 and gemma2

Frederick Boehm

2018-10-21

Source: vignettes/Comparing_limmbo2_covariance_estimates_with_those_of_gemma2.Rmd
Comparing_limmbo2_covariance_estimates_with_those_of_gemma2.Rmd

Background

gemma2 is an R implementation of the C++ code for EM-based estimation of Vg and Ve. limmbo2 is a R wrapper to the limmbo python module.

Goals

I want to see how similar the variance component estimates are for the two methods. Recall that it’s the function qtl2pleio::calc_covs that I want to use to get the estimates based on gemma2’s EM algorithm. limmbo2 in the limmbo2 R package will provide both Vg and Ve.

First, gemma2 method:

library(qtl2pleio)
pheno <- matrix(rnorm(300), nrow = 100)
kinship <- diag(100)
calc_covs(pheno, kinship)
#> $Vg
#>             [,1]         [,2]        [,3]
#> [1,] 0.586828172  0.007224945  0.01449510
#> [2,] 0.007224945  0.432213860 -0.04644482
#> [3,] 0.014495102 -0.046444819  0.49066400
#> 
#> $Ve
#>             [,1]         [,2]        [,3]
#> [1,] 0.586828172  0.007224945  0.01449510
#> [2,] 0.007224945  0.432213860 -0.04644482
#> [3,] 0.014495102 -0.046444819  0.49066400
library(limmbo2)
limmbo2(kinship = kinship, pheno = pheno, seed = 1)
#> $Vg
#>            [,1]        [,2]        [,3]
#> [1,] 0.58331162  0.01359464  0.01268735
#> [2,] 0.01359464  0.44518633 -0.05041714
#> [3,] 0.01268735 -0.05041714  0.48689578
#> 
#> $Ve
#>            [,1]        [,2]        [,3]
#> [1,] 0.58331162  0.01359464  0.01268735
#> [2,] 0.01359464  0.44518633 -0.05041714
#> [3,] 0.01268735 -0.05041714  0.48689578

5-dimensional phenotype comparison of calc_covs() and limmbo2() 

pheno <- matrix(rnorm(500), nrow = 100)
system.time(calc_covs(pheno, kinship))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.128   0.008   0.136
system.time(limmbo2(kinship = kinship, pheno = pheno, seed = 1))
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.377   0.053   6.452

Use nontrivial kinship with trivariate phenotype

n <- 500
A <- matrix(runif(n ^ 2), ncol = n) 
kinship <- round(t(A) %*% A, 6)
pheno <- matrix(rnorm(1500), nrow = 500)

system.time(calc_covs(pheno, 
                      kinship, 
                      max_iter = 1000,
                      max_prec = 1 / 10000) -> cc_out)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>  11.488   0.034  11.541
cc_out
#> $Vg
#>               [,1]          [,2]          [,3]
#> [1,]  0.0021051664 -0.0006011204 -0.0001451753
#> [2,] -0.0006011204  0.0021903920 -0.0003319108
#> [3,] -0.0001451753 -0.0003319108  0.0011384084
#> 
#> $Ve
#>             [,1]       [,2]        [,3]
#> [1,]  0.96222538 0.09127239 -0.07236913
#> [2,]  0.09127239 1.00453862  0.06587978
#> [3,] -0.07236913 0.06587978  1.02168605
system.time(limmbo2(kinship = kinship, 
                    pheno = pheno, 
                    S = 3, 
                    seed = 1) -> li_out)
#>    user  system elapsed 
#>   0.643   0.034   4.554
li_out
#> $Vg
#>               [,1]          [,2]          [,3]
#> [1,]  0.0007402132 -0.0008593320  0.0002340606
#> [2,] -0.0008593320  0.0015451209 -0.0003680764
#> [3,]  0.0002340606 -0.0003680764  0.0002940170
#> 
#> $Ve
#>             [,1]       [,2]        [,3]
#> [1,]  1.01886372 0.10593431 -0.08926889
#> [2,]  0.10593431 1.02918057  0.06799847
#> [3,] -0.08926889 0.06799847  1.05914291
